title: Which K-pop groups are going to disband by 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: The ones that are in question are most likely the ones who would be reaching their 7th year in 2020. (unless they’ve got a strong fan base, have continuous comebacks, and a good company backing them) SM Entertainment - It would be very doubtful that almost any of their groups would disband. There might be a hiatus, but not disbandment. Look at TVXQ and Super Junior. In the case of Girls’ Generation, since members, three members have left SM, but not the group, we will most likely be seeing more solo or sub-unit comebacks than a full group comeback in the near future. The members who have left SM (Tiffany, Sooyoung, Seohyun) will be focusing more on their acting and solo music careers before future activities as Girls’ Generation. For EXO, there will be a period where they wouldn’t be all the members on the stage, but it’s doubtful that they will disband. Looking at their current high popularity not just in Korea, but around the world, I’d say that it is highly unlikely of a chance. SM Entertainment is also very stubborn in letting artists go. ————————————————————————————————————— For example. f(x) hasn’t been active as a group since 2015. But each of the four members are independently active. Victoria - solo debut, TV shows (variety and scouting program), dramasAmber - mixtape, signing with Steel Wool Entertainment (represents her in the U.S.), releasing White Noise and Lost at Sea. [1]Luna - collaborations, and soloKrystal - dramaNew Info: Amber, Luna, and Victoria have decided not to renew their contracts with SM Entertainment. But are technically still part of f(x). They are focusing more on their solo careers than as a group. The group has disbanded. ————————————————————————————————————— As for other entertainment companies, I don’t know for sure. But groups that debuted in from 2012–2014, include BTS, Boys Republic, BAP, BtoB, Big Star, VIXX, EXID, A-Jax, GOT7, Lovely, etc… But there are groups who are strong now and will continue to make amazing music in the future. Idols Groups that are most likely not going to disband (in my opinion): BTS, VIXX, BtoB, Nu’est, EXO, Winner, HOTSHOT, Seventeen, and GOT7. (There are a lot more groups, but I just don’t have the time to name them all. We would be here for a while if I did that. EBS (EXO, BTS, Seventeen)the public considers them the three most popular groups.EXONo way are they disbanding anytime soon. Even though members will start their mandatory military services soon, there will always be at least one member not in the military. For example, the Xiumin and Sehun will most likely (99.9999999%) will not be serving at the same time. There will be comebacks, sub-units, and possibly more solo debuts(?) while they have members in service.BTSWith their high popularity at the moment, I doubt it will be dying down any time soon. They renewed their contracts in October, meaning that they will stay with Big Hit till 2026 and then decide from there.SeventeenThey’re high in popularity. Plus they won’t be going to the military anytime soon because the three oldest members are ‘95 liners. Also, didn’t Dino just graduate from high school either this year or last year? There’s an age gap between the leader and the maknae.VIXXI don’t listen to their music, but I have heard amazing things about them. Recently, I listened to Shangri-La because of Under Nineteen Performance Team’s performance of it, and it led to me watching their music video. I absolutely loved it. (trying to find navy and gold hearts, this was the best I could find)BtoBThey’re still going strong, and some of the members have solo music out. Members are starting to head to the military, but I doubt that will have a significant impact on their popularity as they’re not going in all at once, so there will be a domino effect when they come out. Most recent comeback: November 2018.Nu’estCurrently, they are performing as Nu’est W while Minhyun is participating in Wanna One. After the contract of Wanna One is over, he will be returning to Nu’est, and they will have a comeback as five members. JR mentioned something about this…After Produce 101 Season 2, Nu’est W blew up with their extended play W, Here with the title song, Where You At. They later had a comeback with Dejavu. (I haven’t kept track of everything. Trying to keep up but failing.) They’re hot right now, and because of the push from their time on the survival show, it isn't going down anytime soon.HOTSHOT4/6 members have participated in survival shows. Sungwoon in Wanna One, Taehyun formerly in JBJ, Hojung in UNB (btw they disband in January 2019). Plus they just released “I Hate You.” Currently, they’re getting more attention. (While I am not HOTPLE, I enjoy their music and have bought their recent album on iTunes. Going to listen to more of their music in 2019!) [2]GOT7Same as VIXX, I don’t listen to their music and don’t exactly pay much attention to them, but they’re going strong. They’re one of the more popular groups, so there’s a tiny chance of disbanding in a couple of years.Note: Male idol groups with multiple members will most likely not be able to promote even with fewer members. This occurred with Super Junior and will most likely happen again with groups with the number of members over 8 or 9. If anything, there will be some disbandments. Most groups don’t last more than seven years, aka the 7-year curse. A lot of second-generation groups including 2NE1, Sistar, 4Minute, and Rainbow have disbanded after seven years as a group. I wouldn’t be too surprised. Idols Groups that are most likely going to disband (in my opinion): A-Jax (only active in Japan. Aren’t they a k-pop group that was formed in South Korea?), 15& (they’ve been on hiatus awhile now), 24k, A.cian (even though they appeared on the Unit, not much attention, no music release since 2016). I would also add Boys Republic (currently on an indefinite hiatus) and possibly B.A.P (has disbanded). ⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️ Update: A-Jax - disbanded[3]Poor managementActivities strictly in JapanLatest Release - ‘YOU’ (Japanese release)24k - a season of new members. A lot of the members in the original line-up have left the group. I hope they gain a bigger fan base within South Korea. Most recent comeback - May 25, 2018 (Bonnie N Clyde). [4]As of January 25, 2019 - the oldest member and leader of the group, Cory, decided to leave the group. He was also one of the original members. If Sungoh also decides to leave 24K, it would mean that the line-up they would have would include none of the original members. [5][6]Boys Republic - on September 12, 2018, it was announced that they would be going on an indefinite hiatus. Who knows when they will be back. [7]A.cian - no music recorded since 2016. Lots of lineup changes. Most recent music video - March 23, 2016.15& - Disbanded. The group had a hiatus starting in 2015 and both members left the company in 2019.Park Jimin - released her second EP Jiminxjamie on September 4, 2018. Plus she’s active on the show After School Club.Baek Yerin - she’s a solo artist - more informationB.A.P - Disbanded. They’ve been somewhat under the radar a bit. (Maybe I’m totally wrong about this, please correct me if I am.) Also, members are starting to leave the group, beginning with Yongguk and Zelo. I’m somewhat worried about them as a group, but each of the members is so talented, I’m not concerned about them individually, just as a group. For example, Daehyun released a solo single, Baby, less than a month ago. [8][9][10]KNK - active - 220 Entertainmentnot disbanding anytime soon.B1A4 - My explanation for this group is before in the second paragraph for HIATUS. Also, CNU will be enlisting on January 22. Who knows if they will either be doing solo work, group work, or hiatus for a while before coming back as a group. We don’t even know if this will be a group of three or five members.Girl’s Day - UPDATE: They will be not be disbanding after their contracts end with Dream T Entertainment. [11]➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡ HIATUS In general for groups who are currently named as on hiatus, for example, ZE:A. Even though they debuted in Star Empire Entertainment, every single member has left that company and are in different companies. It is difficult to organize a comeback where the members are separated by companies, schedules, aka EVERYTHING. Looking for their hopeful comeback in the near future, but feeling somewhat unlikely as each member is focusing more on their solo activities. This is not just for ZE:A but for all groups who are currently inactive with members in different companies. Another example: On July 2, 2018, B1A4 Jinyoung and Baro left WM Entertainment to pursue another career path. Sandeul expressed frustration that with members in different entertainment companies it would make it harder for B1A4 as a group to make a comeback. Since the situation of Jinyoung and Baro is unknown, WM has announced that the remaining three members will promote the group as three members until the situation has been finalized. But it does not mean that they will not be a five-member group. Source: Sandeul Expressed Frustration and Apologized to Fans about Things Happened to B1A4 Groups currently on hiatus include: f(x)ZE:ASS501 - full group, not sub-unit, however, the members are planning to have a comeback sometime soon.Boys Republic - indefinite hiatusJYJ - I’m not too worried about them, because they are all individually successful.➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡➡ Groups who haven’t disbanded officially, but can we kinda assume? After School - the group has disbanded on their own.similar to other groups, After School’s system is like high school. You join and later graduate.The majority of the members have left the group (graduated) and Pledis Entertainment, pursuing other careers.Kaeun will be debuting in another girl group - confirmed by former member Lizzy.Nana is actingRaina going solo and her own YouTube channelHello Venus - Disbanded on May 8, 2019no music since 2017Nara is actingSunny Hill - updated!if they continue to have more constant comebacks, then I wouldn’t worry too much about them.There are so many other k-pop idol groups, but many of them are unknown to t, resulting in them having high possibilities of disbanding. Every year there have been so many k-pop groups that debut and think they finally have achieved their dreams, but realize that they have to continue working hard even to be known. Take 24k on Mix Nine. He never even heard of 24k until Mix Nine. 24k debuted in 2012, that’s about five years from their debut to their audition for Mix Nine. Or Nu’est on Produce 101 Season 2. If you hear Minhyun on Happy Together, he explains the hardships that he suffered before appearing on Produce 101. [12] “Being an idol isn’t easy, it’s really hard and you have to endure all the pain. You will be acknowledged when you surpass your own skill. Ah, you really have become an idol” - Kim Samuel (Produce 101 Season 2 Audition Cut) [13] Note: Updated 8/12/2020 I mainly listen to male idol groups and don’t have much knowledge about girl groups. If any of the information I have written above is incorrect, feel free to post a comment below and I will get to you as soon as possible. Footnotes[1] f(x) Amber released her mixtape and fans are loving it[2] Watch: HOTSHOT Members Reminiscently Say “I Hate You” In MV[3] A-JAX To Disband After 7 Years[4] Watch: 24K Makes Anticipated Comeback With New MV For “Bonnie N Clyde”[5] Watch: 24K Reveals Reasons For Appearing On “MIXNINE” + Thoughts On Success[6] 24K Issues Official Statement Regarding Cory’s Departure + Sungoh’s Possible Return[7] Boys Republic Announces Indefinite Hiatus[8] Breaking: B1A4’s Jinyoung And Baro Leave WM Entertainment, Agency Addresses Plans For Group[9] Bang Yong Guk Writes Heartfelt Letter To Fans About Departure From B.A.P[10] Zelo Confirmed To Leave B.A.P[11] Girl’s Day’s Sojin To Leave Dream T + Agency Denies Disbandment[12] NU’EST Members Open Up About Why They Decided To Appear On “Produce 101 Season 2”[13] Samuel Shares His Thoughts About Starting Idol Training At A Young Age

In my opinion the groups that I THINK are going to disband will be some popular groups or even non popular groups. OK, for me I think sooner or later EXO will disband, because it looks like SM wants to use NCT more than EXO. Literally they didn’t let EXO comeback sooner, but here’s the thing, EXO is the group that helps the company, EXO is very talented and if they do ever break up they will have a good solo career for each member. Lay already does have a good solo part when he’s not doing anything with the group. He’s been in movies and his music is still getting a lot of attention. The group again MIGHT disband, doesn’t mean they will disband. I feel like they will not disband, but then some other reasons make me think that they will disband. Now I know that there are groups who aren't that big and they also might disband, because they don't come from a big ass company and the company does not know how to manage them at all. That’s actually really sad to me, because the same thing happened with the group TOPP DOGG. They had amazing songs and then people started to leave the group, which I was sad that they did leave. This happened with BTS they didn't think that they will make it and they did actually almost disband. But now look at them, they already signed their contract to be with them for 7 more years. They would be that group to be known forever. These two groups came from nothing and one of them didn't want this anymore and the other did. Groups that disband is sad and I wish that their company works harder for them and not just sit around their asses and watch their money go to waste. For big groups, now they can actually not wanna renew their contracts, so with SNSD a few members didn't renew their contracts and I’m not even mad, it’s just that they want to do their own things and I wish a lot of people understood that. There’s so many reasons why a group will disband: Bad managementMembers want to leaveScandalsNot renewing their contractsSo many things and make or break a group and that’s that.

1.AOA Without Jimin (who has left the group due to bully-controversy with former member Mina) there is no chance AOA will survive. Jimin was the leader and without a leader, they will disband.  2.MAMAMOO Some members have talked about not renewing the contracts. Next year will be the 7th year, and it's likely that they won't renew those contracts. They might disband this year but we never know. Nonetheless, they are still icons.  3.BLACKPINK I'm sorry but they get so much damn hate from people. They are all mistreated & literally aren't ok under YG. BLINKs have protested for so long. It isn't fair how their fandom has tried so hard to get the treatment BLACKPINK need. I hope the girls' find happiness/feel happy soon.. (Edit: I read some of the comments. You can skip this part as I got confused with the statement.)  4.GOT7 It hurts to say that as an AGHASE, they are so likely to disband soon. I felt so sad when I heard they don't have good control over their music. And how it's obvious JYP ent. mistreats them.. it hurts my heart. I don't expect them to keep going into 2021.  That was just who I think isn't going to make it to 2021. Feel free to leave comments of your opinions and some more groups to add. I read all of them ❤ Feel free to disagree if you want!! Bye.  Edit: If you're going to leave hateful comments, you will be blocked. Don't try & slime your way out. Don't be disrespectful either. K-POP isn't Shitty as you. So stop.

KPop groups that most people haven’t heard of, or ones whom the current crop of fans think disbanded a long time ago LOL Of the ones people do tend to know: iKON might be in trouble - but I hope they just dump YG and pick up B.I. to go on with their careers. Big Bang - people are making noises about them, but I doubt they will break up per se. Limited concerts together perhaps…. JYJ almost certainly will not be happening again, cause Yoochun. Junsu is the ruling deity of Korean musical theater, and Jae Joong is just THE Asian rock singer, so there’s not much reason to keep JYJ going at all. I’m very certain we will continue to see Xia & JJ perform together from time to time, however! Did you know that SS501 have never disbanded? I expect a reunion concert out of them - the various members keep talking about it and all are done with MS now. KHJ has been vindicated (both of them actually LOL) so I’m waiting for that - but there’s complications (3 different companies to deal with). Still, it will not be a return to regular touring and releasing of albums, but just a brief ‘let’s get together’ kind of thing. The guys all have their own solo careers going on. Beast/ Highlight - I just don’t know. They went thru so much with Cube, and put it behind them to comeback successfully with a new name, but then Jon Yoon Hyung left right before starting MS - ostensibly for looking at JJY’s infamous ‘golden phone’ but that seems weak. Something else seems to be going on. But of course we won’t know because all the members are in MS now.

response.answer_text: I definitely think B.A.P will disband soon, likely in 2019. First of all, their leader Yongguk did not renew his contract with TS Entertainment, the agency that manages the group. TS has been notorious for being a very poor company and B.A.P themselves have sued the agency for poor working conditions. Yongguk left in August after his contract expired. Shortly afterwards, Himchan was accused of sexual harassment. The allegations lead to prosecution and indictment, and there has been little to no news about the case ever since then. This obviously hurt the band’s reputation. A few days ago, another member announced his departure from the group and the agency. Zelo’s contract expired in early December and, like Yongguk, he chose not to renew it. This leaves B.A.P with only four members, and if Himchan is charged with sexual assault, it will likely drop to 3. As the other answers said, the 7 Year Curse is a very real thing in the k-pop industry. Most idols sign 7 year contracts when they first debut, and after that much training and hard work, many are ready to call it quits. Plus, all male idols who are Korean nationals are required to serve in the military, so even if the remaining members of B.A.P renewed their contracts (which is highly unlikely after the scandals and drama the group has endured with their members and this company), they would have to serve sooner than later. For this reason, I believe B.A.P will announce their disbandment sooner than later, probably sometime in early 2019. UPDATE: As of February 19th, 2019, the remaining B.A.P members in TS Entertainment have terminated their contracts, thus dissolving the group. I’m sad to see them disband but I’m glad they’re out of that horrific company. Thank you, B.A.P.

I don't think is good to ask this question because it could make fan wars The only confirmed groups to disband before 2020 are The uni+ winner groups. To enter in details and to examine other companies: SM is not gonna disband any group,but is very likely that some could get an hiatus(F(x) and SNSD + someone else) JYP is another case of rare disbanding probability,If the JYP jinx keeps(That the senior group disband after the 2nd rookie is debuted)maybe Twice (Maybe,but isn't likely,NO HATE,I LOVE TWICE) YG couldn't get groups into hiatus rather than Disbanding. Some companies like CUBE or FANTAGIO or similar could face disbanding of groups. And maybe little companies could lost they groups,at least 1–20 rookie groups disband every year. Also BIG HIT will face one hard panorama,a new rookie group and BTS members starting to go to military(Maybe not in 2020 but they can't evade the temporary lost of members,HOPE THEY DOESN'T DISBAND)

I saw people wrote EXO and F(X) might disband by next year however that's not the case.. S.M. doesn't disband any groups.. The groups might go on hiatus but they don't disband. EDIT: As of right now, the EXO members have to start enlisting so in my opinion, it seems like S.M. wanted the 2 recent comebacks [Tempo & Love Shot] to be for fans only as a gift before Kim Min Seok (stage name: Xiumin), Do Kyung Soo (stage name: D.O.) and Kim Jun Myeon (stage name: Suho) enlist in 2019 (this year). Moving onto F(X), the group is on a hiatus after their comeback in 2015 with “4 Walls” . All 4 members are pursuing solo activities at the moment due to Chinese member Victoria not being able to participate with the members because of the China-Korea issue. Also the China-Korea issue is also why EXO's Lay (Zhang Yi Xing) is unable to participate in the comebacks with the group. There are several reasons as to why groups disband but the common ones are: Company management problems (groups would get sexually harassed or physically abused)Contracts are overCompany goes bankrupt (most cases for very small companies) or money problems within the company7 year jinx (Members leave, group goes on hiatus, or group disbands)

AOA, B.A.P, EXID, EXO, BtoB, Nuest, VIXX, BTS, GOT7, Mamamoo, Red Velvet, Winner are bands that will complete 7 years of debuted in 2020. Although BTS was the only group so far that renewed their contract, I believe EXO and maybe Red Velvet will most likely not be disbanding either. I have my doubts about GOT7… 👀 And tbh I don't really listen to the rest of this 2013-14 line so I can't really give an opinion but I don't believe half of them will continue. I also strongly believe that other K-pop bands that hadn't reached yet the 7 years contract will probably be disbanding…. Most likely girlgroups that I won't give names. Oh and Monsta X, depending on how their member situation will end up.

Since it’s a common practice in Kpop that idols sign 7-year contracts, I checked up which groups debuted around 2012–14 and found some famous names: AOA, B.A.P, EXID, EXO, BtoB, Nuest, VIXX, BTS, GOT7, Mamamoo, Red Velvet, Winner…etc. I don’t think all of them will disband by 2020 though. It’s not always a bad thing that idols disband. Some of them have better places to go, or just want to try something new. Idol career can be really consuming and repetitive.

Its really difficult to predict which bands are going to disband in future. As time changes people change and new band coming up so old bands may not get that much recognition. every band member after period of certain years may think of getting into different fields such as acting or they wanted to establish independent identity so they disband or if any member of the band gets into trouble like taking drugs etc then the band may resolve. coming to your question i think shinee, c n blue, super juniors, etc are few boys band which may disband by 2020 but i don’t want any group to disband. Hope this helps! Annyeong! Thank you for reading.

It is honestly really hard to tell. Some groups might lose a member or two by that time because of idols going to the army. I believe when a man turn 30 years old they are drafted into the army. For example Jin from BTS. Jin as of this year is 25 years old. He won’t be drafted in 2022, but 3 years after. Either BTS will go on without him or take a break. So my answer is; it depends on the company and the group.  Hope I helped!! :)

I don't know why anybody answers a question like this. NOBODY KNOWS who is going to disband in 2020 and again, if you are asking this because of mandatory military service, groups don't disband. Frankly if you don't take the time to learn about the country of the artists you stan (or can't stand) in Kpop, don't even bother.

I have a feeling B.A.P is going to leave TS Entertainment when their contract ends just because of the shit they’ve been through, but stay as a group under another company and probably another name. (There’s a big chance TS is going to copyright the name B.A.P.

The girl group “Secret” may be disbanding, due to their last comeback being done several years ago. F(X) may be in danger, due to the fact that their contracts expire this year and SM Entertainment hasn't mentioned anything about renewal. It'd be a shame if these groups disbanded so lets hope that they don't. Hope this answer helps!
I'm sick of this idea of disband. I don't want anyone to disband but every start has a end so all the best for the fans whose favourite band is going to disband in 2020
I think none of the above four bands will leave. Some bands that haven't been active for a long time. they are more likely to disband possible
